Precondition: A courier account exists and has no associated orders.
Expected Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 3 is removed from the Couriers table in the database.
Environment:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 3 is removed from the Couriers table in the database.
Actual Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 3 is removed from the Couriers table in the database.

Precondition: A courier account exists and has several associated orders in the Orders table.
Expected Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 4 is removed from the Couriers table.
3. All orders linked to 4 are removed from the Orders table.
Environment:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 4 is removed from the Couriers table.
3. All orders linked to 4 are removed from the Orders table.
Actual Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 200 OK is returned.
2. The courier record with 4 is removed from the Couriers table.
3. All orders linked to 4 are removed from the Orders table.

Steps: 1. Send DELETE request to /api/v1/courier/:id where the courier ID is nonexistent
Expected Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found (or 400 Bad Request) is returned.
2. An appropriate error message indicating the courier was not found is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
Environment:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found (or 400 Bad Request) is returned.
2. An appropriate error message indicating the courier was not found is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
Actual Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found (or 400 Bad Request) is returned.
2. An appropriate error message indicating the courier was not found is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.

Test Case: Delete Courier with Invalid ID Format
Steps: 1. Send DELETE request to /api/v1/courier/:id where the format of the id is invalid (non-numeric)
Expected Result:
1. An error code is returned.
2. An appropriate error message indicating invalid ID format is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
Actual Result:
1. A 500 error is returned.
2. An appropriate error message indicating invalid ID format is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database."

Expected Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found
2. An appropriate error message is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
Environment:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found (or 405 Method Not Allowed if the route is not defined without an ID).
2. An appropriate error message is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
Actual Result:
1. HTTP Status Code 404 Not Found
2. An appropriate error message is returned.
3. No changes are made to the database.
